info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 1:07AM EDT until September 27 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Surry.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 104 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has moved out of the advisory area, leaving only light to occasionally moderate rainfall. However, as much as 2 inches of rain fell earlier this evening over a short period of time. Localized flooding is ongoing, with runoff from the rain continuing to cause small creeks and streams to remain out of their banks, though water levels continue to fall. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaverdam Creek, Beaver Creek, Brushy Fork, Ararat River and Bull Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Fairview... Flat Rock... Dobson... Bottom... Cana... White Plains... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
